passage_text: Schnapps is a type of distilled spirit that has two meanings. Essentially, schnapps are made by fermenting the fruit along with the base liquor (usually brandy), whereas liqueurs are often made by steeping fruits in alcohol after fermentation and/or distillation.

Alcohol% varies depending on the company as well as what kind of schnapps it is. (peppermint, peach, raspberry, etc.) Do us all a favor and don't drink until you're at least 18 (the age varies by country) unless you want to spend time in jail.

Peppermint Schnapps. Peppermint Schnapps is a liqueur which has a taste somewhat similar to that of a candy cane. Its flavor is similar to Creme de Menthe, but is not as sweet and is generally clear in color.

This peppermint liqueur recipe is similar to peppermint schnapps. It's an easy-to-make liqueur that is tasty to mix in hot chocolate and a number of mixed cocktails. (Those cocktail recipes will follow in another post.) This liqueur is festive and perfect for holiday giving.

Adorable animal families that will make you aww. Peppermint schnapps is a type of liqueur. It is manufactured with a pure grain alcohol base to which peppermint flavoring is added. The liqueur's texture is thick and resembles syrup. It can be consumed over ice or in a number of mixed drinks. This variety of schnapps can also be used when cooking a number of dishes.

Peppermint schnapps is a clear, mint-flavored distilled spirit that is often used in winter cocktails. It is less sweet and typically contains more alcohol than creme crème de. Menthe there are many brands that produce peppermint schnapps and the, quality, price and production can vary quite a. bit
